Such notice shall include specification of any additional information to be provided by the grantee pursuant to paragraph B (vii) below. Unless specifically waived by the town council, attendance of grantee's duly authorized representative at these meetings shall be mandatory. 
B.  Within 60 days from receipt of such notification, the grantee shall file a report with the town that is certified by a representative of the grantee knowledgeable of the operations of grantee within the town, in reasonable detail, specifically addressing, at a minimum, the following areas: 
(i)  Compliance with the requirements specified in subsection 10.04 of the franchise; 
(ii)  Compliance with the requirements regarding technical performance and testing, as provided in subsection 12.02 of this franchise; 
(iii)  Compliance with the PEG channel requirements, as provided in subsections 14.01 and 14.02; 
(iv)  Compliance with the customer service standards, as provided in exhibit A of this franchise; 
(v)  A summary of the development of new cable services and the use of new technologies, subject to subsection 19.04; 
(vi)  A comparison of rates to any benchmarks or standards set by federal, state, or local agencies having jurisdiction; and 
(vii)  Any other topic deemed material or relevant by the town for its enforcement of this franchise. 
C.  All reports to be prepared under this subsection and submitted by grantee shall be based on information since the previous performance evaluation up to and inclusive of the most current quarter available and not data that ends more than six months before the time of the performance evaluation. 
D.  Following receipt of the report, but not less then 30 days prior to the performance evaluation, the town may request additional information, clarification or detailed documentation concerning those topics identified for inclusion in the performance evaluation. Grantee shall make reasonable effort to provide such additional information to the town prior to the meeting. In the event that the information cannot be made available prior to the performance evaluation, grantee shall notify the town in writing explaining the reasons for such delay. 
E.  The town council may hear any interested persons during such performance evaluation. The grantee shall be entitled to all the rights of due process consistent with the town proceedings, including but not limited to, the right to present evidence and the right to be represented by counsel. 
F.  The foregoing notwithstanding, the town council may initiate and conduct such additional performance evaluations regarding grantee's performance under this franchise as the town council, in its sole discretion, may deem justified or necessary under the circumstances. Grantee shall be given reasonable notice of the date, time, and location of any such additional performance evaluations. 
G.  Upon request of the town, grantee shall assist the town in notifying subscribers of the triennial evaluation sessions. Nominal costs associated with the notification, in an amount not to exceed $1,500.00, shall be borne by the grantee. 
4.04  Renewal. Grantee and town agree that franchise renewal proceedings shall be governed by the Communications Act, or other law applicable at the time of renewal. 
SECTION 5  
5.0 - Recoupment of costs by town. 
5.01  Publication costs. Any and all costs of publication of this franchise which may be required by law or action of town council shall be borne by grantee. Any payments made by the town under this provision are to be reimbursed to the town within 30 days of grantee's receipt of the invoice. 
SECTION 6  
6.0 - Compliance with town, state, and federal laws. 
6.01  Compliance with applicable laws. Grantee shall at all times comply with all generally applicable laws, rules, and regulations of the town, state and federal governments and any administrative agencies thereof. 
6.02  Subject to police power of the town. The construction, maintenance, and operation of grantee's cable system and all property of grantee subject to the provisions of this franchise shall be subject to all lawful police powers, rules, and regulations of the town. The town shall have the power at any time to order and require grantee to remove or abate any pole, line, tower, wire, cable, guy, conduit, electric conductor, or any other structure or facility that is dangerous to life or property. In the event grantee, after written notice, fails or refuses to act within 15 days of such written notice, town shall have the power to remove or abate the same at the expense of grantee, all without compensation or liability for damages to grantee except in instances where the damage was caused by the gross negligence or willful misconduct of the town or its agents. 
6.03  Notification in the event of pre-emptive law. Grantee shall use its best efforts to notify the town in the event of any change in law that materially affects grantee's rights or obligations under this franchise. 
SECTION 7  
7.0 - Conditions of public rights-of-way occupancy. 
7.01  Use. All structures, wires, cables, equipment, and facilities erected or maintained by grantee within the town shall be located as to cause minimum interference with the proper and intended use of the public rights-of-way and with the rights or reasonable convenience of the owners or occupants of property which adjoins any of such public rights-of-way. The location of all poles, towers, anchors, wires, cables, electronic conductors, conduits, manholes and other structures and appurtenances in, over, under, along, and across the present and future public rights-of-way in the town shall be fixed under the supervision of the town or an authorized agent appointed by the town. Grantee agrees to comply with all other town laws, rules, or ordinances that govern the use of public rights-of-way that currently exist or may be applicable during the term of this franchise, provided that such are promulgated under the town's lawful police powers. In the event that there is conflict between requirements of this franchise and other generally applicable and lawful town ordinances governing grantee's ability to use the public rights-of-way, the stricter provisions shall apply. 
7.02  Excavation. Grantee may excavate only for the construction, installation, expansion, repair, removal, and maintenance of all or a portion of its facilities used to provide cable service under this franchise. Except in the case of emergency maintenance, grantee shall provide the town written notice within 15 days of any proposed disturbance to any public rights-of-way prior to the commencement thereof. Grantee shall provide the town with notice within 24 hours following any emergency maintenance that disturbed the public rights-of-way. Owners or occupants of adjoining property shall be given reasonable notice. When the grantee shall make or cause to be made excavations or shall place obstructions in any public rights-of-way, the public shall be protected by barriers and lights placed, erected, and maintained by the grantee in accordance with any existing or future town, state, or federal requirements. No public rights-of-way shall be encumbered by construction, maintenance, removal, restoration, or repair work by grantee for a longer period than shall be necessary to execute such work. 
7.03  Restoration. The surface of any public rights-of-way disturbed by grantee in laying, constructing, maintaining, operating, using, extending, removing, replacing, or repairing its cable system shall be restored by grantee as soon as reasonably possible, but in no instance greater than 30 days after the completion of the work under normal operating conditions, at its cost and expense, to as good a condition as before the commencement of the work. The 30-day period shall be extended for days that the grantee is unable to perform the work due to unfavorable weather conditions. In the event restoration is scheduled to take longer than 30 days for any other reason, grantee shall provide the town with written notice as to the reason(s) for the delay. Such restoration shall be maintained by grantee to the satisfaction of the town for one year from the date of completion of such restoration work. If there is an unreasonable delay by grantee in restoring and maintaining public rights-of-way after such excavations or repairs have been made, town shall have the right, following written notice to grantee to which grantee has 48 hours in which to respond, to restore or repair the same and to require grantee to pay to the town the reasonable cost of such restoration or repair all without compensation or liability for damages to the grantee unless such damage was caused by the gross negligence or willful misconduct of the town or its agents. In the event town determines that grantee's use of any of town's public rights-of-way as set forth in this franchise poses an immediate danger to the health, safety or general welfare of the public, town shall have the right to restore or repair same and shall require grantee to pay to the town the reasonable costs incurred regarding same, all without compensation or liability for damages to the grantee unless the damage was caused by the gross negligence or willful misconduct of the town or its agents. 
7.04  Relocation. Whenever by reason of the construction, repair, maintenance, relocation, widening, raising, or lowering of the grade of any public rights-of-way by the town or by the location or manner of construction, reconstruction, maintenance, or repair of any public property, structure, or facility by the town, it shall be deemed necessary by the town for grantee to move, relocate, change, alter, or modify any of its facilities or structures, such change, relocation, alteration, or modification shall be promptly made by grantee, when directed in writing to do so by the town. Grantee shall pay the cost of such relocation unless there are funds allocated to affected users of the public right-of-way, including grantee, for the reimbursement of such costs. If the funds are controlled by another governmental entity, the town shall make application for such funds on behalf of the grantee, upon request of grantee, if grantee cannot make such application itself. In the event grantee, after such notice, fails or refuses to commence, pursue, or complete such relocation work within a reasonable time, the town shall have the authority, but not the obligation, to remove or abate such structures or facilities and to require grantee to pay to the town the reasonable cost of such removal or abatement, all without compensation or liability for damages to grantee unless such damage was caused by the gross negligence or willful misconduct of the town or its agents. 
7.05  Temporary removal of wire for building moving. Upon written request of any person holding a building moving permit issued by the town, grantee shall remove, raise, or lower its wires and cables temporarily to permit the moving of houses, buildings, or other bulky structures. The reasonable expense of such temporary removal, raising, or lowering shall be paid by the benefited person, and grantee may require such payment in advance, grantee being without obligation to remove, raise, or lower its wires and cables until such payment shall have been made. Grantee shall be given not less than 72 hours' advance written notice to arrange for such temporary wire and cable adjustments. 
7.06  Tree trimming. From time to time, the town council may pass ordinances regulating the trimming or removal of trees on or along town property, and grantee shall comply with these ordinances. 
7.07  Placement of fixtures. Grantee shall not place poles, towers, or similar fixtures where the same will interfere with any gas, electric, telecommunications, water hydrant, water main, drainage, sanitary sewer or other facilities located within the town's public rights-of-way as authorized by the town, and all such poles, towers, and similar facilities shall be placed as directed by the town and in such manner as not to interfere with the usual travel or use or visibility of the public rights-of-way. 
7.08  Removal of fixtures. Grantee shall remove its structures, wires, cables, equipment, and facilities of any and all kinds from the public rights-of-way within 30 days following the non-use or cessation of use of such structures, wires, cables, equipment, and facilities. 
7.09  Approval of plans and specifications. With the exception of installation of individual drops and/or emergency repairs, grantee shall provide complete plans and specifications for all construction within public rights-of-way to the town for its review in accordance with applicable town ordinances and permit application procedures. Approval of plans and specifications shall not be unreasonably delayed or denied. In the event of rejection, grantee shall submit revised plans and specifications for approval. This provision shall apply to each construction sequence if the construction is accomplished in phases. 
7.10  Underground installation. In those portions of the town having telephone lines and electric utility lines underground, whether required by ordinance or not, any and all of grantee's lines, cables, and wires shall also be underground. Grantee's lines, cables, wires, and similar facilities located above ground prior to the effective date of this franchise shall be relocated underground by grantee at the same time that other above-ground utility lines (e.g., electric and telecommunications lines) located within the immediate vicinity of grantee's facilities are placed underground. Grantee shall pay the cost of such relocation unless there are funds allocated to affected users of the public right-of-way, including grantee, for the reimbursement of such costs. If the funds are controlled by another governmental entity, the town shall make application for such funds on behalf of the grantee upon request of grantee if grantee cannot make such application itself. It shall be the policy of the town that existing poles for electric and communications purposes be utilized by grantee whenever possible and that underground installation, even when not required, is preferable to the placing of additional poles. 
7.11  Facilities location. From time to time, the town or its representatives, may request identification of the specific location of certain grantee cable system facilities. The grantee agrees to respond to such request within 48 hours of the receipt of the request. In the event that grantee fails to provide the necessary information, and damage is caused to grantee facilities as a direct result of withholding said information, the grantee shall hold the town harmless from all liability, damage, cost or expense resulting from any town action in this regard unless such damage was caused by the gross negligence or willful misconduct of the town or its agents. 
The town shall have the right to be informed as to matters in connection with or affecting the construction, reconstruction, maintenance, operations, and repair of the cable system facilities of the grantee within the public rights-of-way including, but not necessarily limited to, the identification and location of the grantee's cable system facilities within the public rights-of-way and to updates of such information as changes regarding same occur. At a minimum, this requires grantee to maintain on file with the town a current set of strand and trench drawings of the cable system. Such strand and trench maps shall be updated as changes occur in the cable system, and shall provide, as follows: 
A.  CAD drawings must be submitted in .dxf (drawing exchange file) or other mutually agreeable format. 
B.  Drawings must be submitted digitally on either CD ROM or floppy diskette. 
C.  Drawings must be referenced in real world coordinates: 
(i)  North Central Texas State Plane; 
(ii)  Zone 5351; 
(iii)  NAD 83 datum; 
(iv)  Units feet. 
In addition to providing the location of grantee's facilities, grantee agrees to obtain facilities location information from other users of the public rights-of-way prior to grantee's construction, reconstruction, maintenance, operations and repair of the cable system facilities. 
Upon request by the town, the grantee shall furnish the town information relevant to such matters, which is prepared, maintained, and available in the ordinary course of business. 
SECTION 8  
8.0 - Indemnification and liability. 
8.01  Grantee's obligation. Grantee shall pay, and by the acceptance of this franchise specifically agrees that it will pay, the following: 
A.  Damages and penalties. All damages or penalties which the town, its officers, agents, employees, or contractors may legally be required to pay as a result of damages arising out of copyright infringements and all other damages arising out of the installation, maintenance, or operation of the cable system by the grantee, its affiliates, contractors, subcontractors or agents, whether or not any act or omission complained of is authorized, allowed, or prohibited by this franchise. 
B.  Expenses. If any action or proceeding is brought against the town or any of its officers, agents, employees, or contractors with respect to which payment may be sought for claims for damages or penalties described in this section, the grantee, upon written notice from the town, shall assume the investigation or defense and fully control any resolution or compromise thereof, including the employment of counsel and the payment of all expenses including the reasonable value of any services rendered by any officers, agents, employees or contractors of the town which are not unreasonably duplicative of services provided by grantee and its representatives. The town shall fully cooperate with the grantee. 
C.  Separate counsel. The town shall have the right to employ separate counsel in any action or proceeding and to participate in the investigation and defense thereof, and the grantee shall pay the reasonable fees and expenses of such separate counsel if employed with the approval and consent of the grantee or if representation of both the grantee and the town by the same attorney would be inconsistent with accepted canons of professional ethics. 
D.  Indemnification. It is the intent of this section and by its acceptance of this franchise, grantee specifically agrees that grantee, for itself and its agents, employees, subcontractors, and the agents and employees of said subcontractors, shall indemnify and hold the town, its officers, agents, employees, contractors, elected officials, successors and assigns harmless from all liability actions, causes of action, lawsuits, judgments, claims, damages, penalties, costs or fees, including attorney's fees and costs of defense, for any injury to or the death of any person or damage to or destruction of any property arising out of, resulting from or based upon, in whole or in part, any act or omission of grantee, its officers, employees, contractors, subcontractors, and agents under this franchise, including without limitation the construction, operation, or maintenance of its cable system. In the event that any action, suit or proceeding is brought or claim is made against the town based upon or arising out of any such act or omission of the grantee under this franchise, the town shall give notice in writing of such action, suit, proceeding or claim to the grantee. However, the failure of the town to promptly provide such notice in writing to grantee shall not relieve grantee of its duties and obligations under this section. The town shall not and does not by reason of this granting of this franchise, or any failure to act by the town which may impact the grantee's performance under this franchise, assume any liability of grantee whatsoever for injury to persons, damage to property, or penalties of any kind whatsoever. The provisions of this section shall survive the expiration or earlier termination of this franchise. 
SECTION 9  
9.0 - Insurance requirements. 
9.01  Minimum coverage. Grantee, for itself, its contractors, and subcontractors, shall maintain throughout the term of this franchise: 
A.  A commercial general liability insurance policy issued by a company duly authorized to do business in the State of Texas (and acceptable to the town) insuring the grantee, its contractors, and its subcontractors with respect to the installation, maintenance, and operation of grantee's cable system in the following minimum amounts: 
(i)  One person. One million dollars for bodily injury or death to any one person. 
(ii)  One accident. One million dollars for bodily injury or death resulting from any one accident. 
(iii)  Property damage. One million dollars for property damage resulting from any one occurrence. 
(iv)  All other types of liability. Two million dollars for all other types of liability per occurrence. 
B.  An automobile liability insurance policy and, if necessary, a commercial umbrella liability insurance policy with a limit of not less than $1,000,000.00 for each accident. Such insurance shall cover liability arising out of any motor vehicle (including owned, hired, and non-owned vehicles). 
9.02  Increased coverage. The town council reserves the right to require grantee to increase the minimum amounts of liability insurance coverage up to $4,000,000.00 per incident if such increased coverage is deemed by town council to be reasonably based on changes in statutory law, court decisions, or the claims history of the industry or the grantee. Such requirement shall be expressed by resolution or ordinance. 
9.03  Endorsements. Grantee agrees that with respect to the insurance requirements contained in subsection 9.01, all insurance certificates will contain the following required provisions: 
A.  Name the Town of Flower Mound and its officers, employees, and elected representatives as additional insured. 
B.  Provide for 30 days' notice to the town for cancellation, non-renewal or material change. 
C.  Shall be on an occurrence basis and shall be primary coverage of all losses resulting from grantee's operations covered by the policies. 
9.04  Workers' compensation. The grantee, its contractors, and its subcontractors shall maintain throughout the term of this franchise workers' compensation within statutory limits and employers liability insurance in the amount of a) by accident, $100,000.00 per each accident, and b) by disease, $100,000.00 per employee with a policy aggregate or $500,000.00, or an amount which is required by applicable state or federal law, whichever is greater. 
9.05  Certificate of insurance. Within 30 days after the effective date of this franchise, grantee shall provide to the town and maintain on file throughout the term of the franchise a certificate of insurance evidencing coverage as required in this section. At the town's request, such request to be based only on evidence which suggests that the certificates supplied are incorrect, a true and correct copy of the insurance policies shall be made available for the town's review at grantee's offices. If grantee elects to make such policies available for review outside of the Dallas/Fort Worth, Texas, metropolitan area, grantee shall pay the travel costs for a town representative to review such policies. The town will not be allowed to make copies of the insurance policies. 
9.06  Term. The insurance required by subsection 9.01 shall be kept in full force and effect by grantee during the existence of this franchise and thereafter until after the removal of all poles, wires, cables, underground conduits, manholes, and other conductors and fixtures incident to the maintenance and operation of grantee's cable system, should such removal be required by town council or undertaken by grantee. 
9.07  Issuing companies. Companies issuing the insurance policies shall have no recourse against the town for payment of any premiums or assessments which all are set at the sole risk of the grantee. Insurance policies obtained by grantee shall provide that the issuing company waives all right of recovery by way of subrogation against the town in connection with any damage covered by these policies. 
SECTION 10  
10.0 - Cable system characteristics. 
10.01  Channel capacity. As of the effective date of this franchise, the cable system shall have the potential of providing no fewer than 74 channels. At no time during the term of this franchise shall grantee offer fewer than 68 channels to subscribers. All channels being offered to subscribers within the franchise area will adhere to the technical standards set forth in section 12. 
10.02  New construction. Any areas of the town where grantee constructs new cable system facilities shall be built, at a minimum, to the same technical specifications as the cable system existing in the town as of the effective date of this franchise. Specifically, including any new construction areas, the average node size in the town shall be no greater than 800 homes per node, unless the grantee provides the town with valid technical justification for a greater average node size. 
10.03  Cable system capabilities. The cable system will have the following attributes during the term of this franchise: 
A.  Activated return capability from subscriber locations, upon the completion of the upgrade of the cable system to a digital format. 
B.  Emergency standby power rated at a minimum of 12 hours at the headend, four hours at each fiber optic node located throughout the cable system with at least 100 subscribers, and one and one-half hours at any other power supply on the distribution portion of the cable system. 
10.04  Comparability of town cable system to others in metroplex. Grantee's cable system in the town shall be capable of offering cable services that are comparable to other cable systems owned or operated by the grantee or an affiliate of the grantee in the Dallas/Fort Worth metropolitan area ("comparable systems") pursuant to the terms of this subsection. If the town believes that there are comparable systems providing more advanced cable services than those offered in the town, the town may send a written request to grantee, not to exceed one notice every three years, requesting information on the cable services offered by the comparable systems. Within 60 days of receiving the request, grantee shall provide the town with information on any cable services that are offered in the comparable systems, but not being offered in the town. If the identified cable services are being offered by grantee or its affiliates to at least 50 percent of the total subscribers in the comparable systems, the town may require that grantee make available such cable services on the cable system in the town. Should the town determine that grantee shall commence provision of such cable services, the town and grantee shall negotiate a schedule for deployment that takes into consideration the impact on subscriber rates, the ability of grantee to recover the cost of such increased capacity or cable services over the remaining life of the franchise from the incremental revenue derived from such additional cable services, and the financial condition of grantee. The parties recognize that, as of the effective date of this franchise, the town is not permitted to require the provision of specific video programming services pursuant to this subsection. 
10.05  Future upgrades. In the event grantee, either voluntarily, or under the terms of subsection 10.04, undertakes an upgrade or rebuild of the cable system during the term of this franchise, at least 30 days prior to the implementation of any upgrade and/or replacement activities, grantee shall provide to the town a written plan which shall include general information as to the construction necessary for the project, and the procedure or method grantee will employ to ensure minimal interruption of cable service. All construction and technical specifications included in the plan(s) submitted by grantee shall be in conformity with the provisions of this franchise, including any lawful and generally applicable town permitting process. Grantee shall meet with the town to discuss the status and progress of the construction upon request. 
SECTION 11  
11.0 - Performance bonding. 
11.01  Amount. Within 30 days of the effective date of this franchise, the grantee shall furnish and keep in full force during the term of the franchise and file with the town a performance bond in the amount of $5,000.00, until such time as grantee's number of doors passed reaches 5,000, at which point grantee will furnish a performance bond of $16,500.00. The bond shall be conditioned upon the faithful performance of the grantee of all terms and conditions of the franchise. Such performance bond will be in addition to any construction bonding requirements of other lawful and generally applicable town ordinances. 
11.02  Reservation of rights. The rights reserved by the town with respect to the bond are in addition to all other rights the town may have under the franchise or any other law. 
11.03  Endorsement. The bond shall contain the following endorsement: 
"It is hereby understood and agreed that this bond may not be changed or cancelled without advance notice to the Town. The Town will be given 30 days written notice by registered mail, return receipt requested, of intent to cancel or not to renew." 
11.04  Evidence. Grantee shall maintain a copy of the bond on file with the town during the term of this franchise. 
SECTION 12  
12.0 - Operational standards. 
12.01  Compliance with FCC rules. At a minimum, grantee shall comply with present and future rules and regulations of the FCC, including, but not limited to, technical standards, testing requirements, consumer protection standards and consumer electronics compatibility regulations and all other present and future rules and regulations of the FCC in connection with and relating to the operation of grantee's cable system. Such compliance will not negate or replace any additional requirements identified in this franchise. 
12.02  Technical performance. 
A.  Grantee's cable system within the town shall meet all FCC and other applicable federal technical and signal quality standards for cable systems, including any such standards or regulations as hereinafter may be amended or adopted to the extent that compliance with such amended standards is mandated by federal law or regulation. In the event that such amended standards are not mandated by federal law or regulation, and provide for a less strict performance standard and/or less frequent testing requirements, such modifications will not be included as a part of this franchise unless the town chooses to incorporate by means of a resolution or amendment hereto. 
B.  Antennas, supporting structures, headend and associated equipment, and outside plant used in the cable system shall comply with any applicable federal, state, county, or generally applicable town laws. 
C.  Grantee shall not design, install or operate its facilities in a manner that will interfere with the signals of any broadcast station, the electrical or telephone system located in any building, the cable system of another franchisee, or individual or master antennas used for receiving television or other broadcast signals. 
D.  If the town contacts grantee prior to the next FCC-required test period (i.e., before December 15 and June 15 of each year), a town representative may be present during the testing. Upon request, grantee shall provide summary written reports of the results of such tests to the town. 
E.  Grantee shall maintain all of its real property, headend facilities and outside plant in a safe condition. Upon request by the town, grantee shall provide copies of the detailed maintenance procedure manuals in existence at the time of the request. 
F.  Grantee shall keep and maintain a proper and adequate inventory of maintenance and repair parts for the cable system. Grantee shall maintain or otherwise have available a work force of skilled technicians for cable system repair and maintenance. 
G.  Upon request, grantee shall provide copies of all correspondence with the FCC related to technical performance of the cable system. In the event that any complaints are filed with the FCC related to the cable system operations, grantee shall provide copies of such complaints as well as the resolution thereof to the town upon request. 
12.03  Parental guidance control. Upon request of a subscriber, grantee shall provide by sale and/or lease a device by which the subscriber can prohibit viewing or use of a particular cable service(s) during periods selected by that subscriber. Subscribers shall be notified individually, in writing, by the grantee of the availability of the device no less frequently than annually. 
12.04  Customer service. The grantee shall provide customer service in accordance with the town's customer service standards set forth in exhibit A. Such standards shall apply to all affiliates that provide cable services to subscribers and any other company that provides cable services under written agreement with the grantee. 
12.05  Quality of service. Throughout the term of this franchise, the grantee shall maintain the quality of service and meet operational standards in the maintenance and operation of its cable system as are required herein. 
Should the town find that the grantee has failed to maintain such quality of service or operational standards, the town may notify the grantee in writing and specifically set forth therein the improvements required to rectify such deficiencies. 
SECTION 13  
13.0 - Signals to be carried. 
13.01  Required programming categories. Grantee shall, at a minimum, carry programming classified under each of the following broad categories so long as such programming remains commercially and reasonably available: 
A.  News and information; 
B.  Arts, culture, performing arts; 
C.  Movies; 
D.  Sports; 
E.  General entertainment; 
F.  Children and family; 
G.  Science; 
H.  Religious; 
I.  Educational; 
J.  Governmental; 
K.  Ethnic; 
L.  Weather; 
M.  Music. 
13.02  Service for the hearing impaired. Grantee shall comply with any FCC or other lawful and applicable federal, state, or local requirements regarding altering or adapting programming for the hearing impaired. Grantee shall not take any action to remove or alter closed captioning provided for the hearing impaired as a part of any programming. Grantee shall deliver intact such closed captioning in the manner in which it arrives at the headend or from another origination source to the cable system. 
13.03  Interconnection. Grantee's subscriber cable system in the town may be interconnected with contiguous cable systems that are owned and operated by grantee or an affiliate, provided that such systems are served by the same headend that serves the town. 
13.04  Use of cable system to provide internet access by multiple providers. The town believes that nondiscriminatory access to the cable system for multiple providers of internet service may be a benefit to subscribers. Therefore, the town reserves the right to adopt requirements for such access to the cable system, subject to applicable law. Prior to such action, the town shall notify the grantee in writing at least 45 days in advance of its intent to impose such a requirement, and hold a hearing, which affords the grantee and other interested members of the public the right to be heard. By approval and acceptance of this franchise, neither the town nor the grantee has waived any rights, obligations, claims, defenses or remedies regarding the town's authority to impose such conditions. 
SECTION 14  
14.0 - Public, educational, and government (PEG) access. 
14.01  Initial channels. As of the effective date of this franchise, grantee shall dedicate three channels for the carriage of PEG programming. The grantee shall ensure that such channels are of a technical quality comparable to any other channel offered over the cable system. 
14.02  Additional channels. Grantee shall make available up to one additional PEG channel (for a total of four PEG channels) under the procedures below. Grantee shall make available up to four additional PEG channels (for a total of eight PEG channels) under the procedures detailed in this section if all the video programming services offered by grantee on the cable system are in a digital format. 
If the town or one of its PEG channel designees believes that additional channel capacity is needed for PEG programming, the interested party may file a request with the town manager. In his/her deliberations, the town manager will consider supply and demand, and, in particular, the ability and resources to produce additional PEG programming, the interest of the community in the additional PEG programming as measured through a survey methodology that is mutually acceptable between the town and the grantee, consideration of the programming that would be displaced, how much programming is produced on the existing PEG channels, how much programming on the existing PEG channels is repeated, how much programming on the existing PEG channels is character-generated, whether it is feasible to cluster PEG programming into blocks of time such that the channel space can be compatibly shared between multiple PEG programming providers, and if several PEG programming providers should combine their programming onto a single PEG channel. 
Should the town manager find that the evidence exists to support the activation of an additional channel for PEG programming, then the town manager shall provide his/her decision in writing and grantee shall provide the channel within 90 days of receiving the request. Grantee may appeal the decision of the town manager to the town council. 
14.03  Underutilized PEG channels. Grantee and the town agree that it is their mutual goal to fully and efficiently use the channel capacity of the cable system, which may include allowing the grantee to use underutilized time on the PEG channels. If grantee believes that any PEG channel has underutilized time, grantee may file a request with the town manager to use that time. In response to the request, the town manager will consider a combination of factors, including, but not limited to, the community's needs and interests, and the source, quantity, type and schedule of the programming carried on the channel. The town manager will also consider, taking into account the mission of the PEG programming, whether it is feasible to cluster PEG programming into blocks of time such that the channel space can be compatibly shared between the PEG programming provider and the grantee and/or if several PEG programming providers can combine their programming onto a single PEG channel. The town manager shall render his/her decision regarding the matter within 60 days of receiving the request. Should the town manager find that the PEG channel or portion of the channel may be used by the grantee, then grantee may begin using such time 90 days after receipt of the decision. The grantee's request shall not be unreasonably denied. Any permission granted pursuant to this subsection for use of a PEG channel or a portion thereof shall be considered temporary. 
At such time as a PEG programming provider believes that it has the resources and ability to utilize any PEG channel currently used by the grantee pursuant to this subsection, the PEG programming provider may request that the town return such PEG channel or portion of a PEG channel being used by the grantee to the PEG programming provider. In response to the request, the town will consider a combination of factors, including, but not limited to, the community's needs and interests, the quantity and schedule of the programming the applicant proposes to carry on the PEG channel, and the applicant's ability and resources to acquire or produce the proposed PEG channel programming. The town will also consider whether it is feasible for the PEG programming provider to cluster programming into blocks of time such that the PEG channel can be compatibly shared between the PEG programming provider and the grantee and/or if several PEG programming providers can combine their programming onto a single PEG channel. The town shall render its decision regarding the matter within 90 days of receiving the request. Should the town find that the evidence exists to support the return of a PEG channel or portion of a PEG channel to the PEG programming provider, then the grantee shall surrender the requested time on the PEG channel within 90 days of receiving the decision. 
14.04  Delivery of PEG programming. PEG programming shall be produced, recorded and transmitted in a format which is compatible with the technology used by the cable system, whether audio, video, or other information (including, by way of example and not limitation, secondary audio, text, digital information, high definition signals and compressed signals). Such uses must be in furtherance of PEG programming uses. 
14.05  Management and control of PEG channels. The town or its designee shall at its discretion manage the use of all PEG channels and facilities and allocate and reallocate the PEG channels amongst public, educational and government access programming. The town may authorize a third party(ies) to control and manage the use of any or all PEG channels and related facilities provided by grantee under this franchise. The town or its designee may formulate rules for the operation of PEG channels consistent with this franchise and federal law. 
14.06  Routing of PEG channel content. Grantee shall continue to provide the necessary upstream channel capacity and equipment to originate PEG channel content from the Town of Flower Mound Town Hall, located at 2121 Cross Timbers Road, Flower Mound, Texas, 75028, for dissemination over the cable system to subscribers, so long as this site is used to originate PEG programming. Grantee shall provide the necessary upstream channel capacity and equipment to route PEG channel content from additional sites as identified by the town within 120 days of said request, provided that the town is responsible for the costs of all construction and equipment. Grantee shall provide the town with an estimate of the construction and equipment costs prior to beginning construction of any new return line. Grantee shall not be responsible for constructing any new return line until the town has approved such costs in writing. 
14.07  Relocation of access channels. Grantee will use reasonable efforts to minimize the movement of PEG channel assignments. Grantee shall provide the town with a minimum of 90 days' notice, and use its best efforts to provide 120 days' notice, prior to the time any PEG channel designation is changed, unless the change is required by federal law, in which case grantee shall give the town the maximum notice possible. In addition, grantee shall pay to the town an amount equal to the town's costs in remarketing the location of the PEG channels and managing the relocation administratively and technologically, up to a maximum of $0.50 per subscriber. Grantee shall only be allowed to recover such amounts paid to the town as "external costs" (as that term is used in 47 C.F.R. section 76.922) if the movement of channels is required by federal, state, or local law. Grantee, at grantee's expense, will place the town's notices of the channel change on or with one regular monthly billing, upon the town's request. Any new channel designations for the PEG channels provided pursuant to this franchise shall be in full compliance with FCC signal quality and proof-of-performance standards. 
14.08  Reception of PEG access signals. All PEG access channels provided for under this section shall be a part of the basic cable service. 
14.09  Technical assistance. Within one hour of a request from the town and/or its designee, identifying a problem and requesting assistance from the grantee regarding a PEG channel, grantee will respond by telephone to address the problem. Within four hours, grantee shall provide technical assistance or diagnostic services to determine whether or not a problem with a PEG channel is the result of matters for which grantee is responsible and, if so, grantee will take prompt corrective action. Such assistance will be at no charge to the town. 
14.10  PEG support. 
A.  Grantee shall provide the town with an initial grant of $5,000.00 at such time as the town requests it during the first year of this franchise for PEG capital, followed by a subsequent contribution of $20,000.00, once the threshold of 5,000 doors passed is reached. The town shall give grantee at least 90 days' advance written notice to submit payment of the grant. Grantee shall be allowed to pass through this payment to subscribers over the term of this franchise. 
B.  Upon at least 90 days' advance written notice the town may require the grantee to provide an additional amount each month not to exceed $0.50 per month, per residential subscriber, as additional capital support for PEG programming. Grantee shall be allowed to pass through these payments to subscribers. 
C.  Grantee shall not be responsible for collecting or paying the PEG capital fee described in subsection 14.10, paragraph B or C on gratis accounts or for subscribers covered by bulk agreements. Each payment shall be due and payable no later than 30 days following the end of the quarter from when the PEG capital fee takes effect. The town may adjust the amount of the PEG capital fee on an annual basis (not to exceed the sum of the amounts specified in subsection 14.10, paragraphs B and C. 
D.  No PEG access channel may be used for the exhibition of any advertisement. For purposes of this section "advertisement" is defined as a message, announcement, or other programming material which is exhibited or otherwise transmitted in exchange for any remuneration and which is intended to (1) promote any service, facility, or product offered by any person who is engaged in such offering for profit; (2) to express the views of any person with respect to any matter of public importance or interest; or (3) to support or oppose any candidate for political office. 
E.  Current PEG equipment. Equipment that is currently provided to the town for PEG channel programming shall become the property of the town at no charge to the town or its subscribers. Equipment which is currently used to provide programming for the public access channel, will also become the property of the town, at no charge to the town or the subscribers. 
F.  Late payment. Grantee shall pay a late charge in an amount which is the greater of $100.00 or 10 percent per annum, compounded daily, on PEG capital fee payments, or portions thereof, that are paid subsequent to the payment dates specified above. 
G.  The town shall have the authority to distribute and re-distribute the PEG capital fee in a manner that is deemed by the town to be in the best interest of the subscribers with respect to PEG programming, in accordance with applicable law. 
SECTION 15  
15.0 - Emergency use of the cable system. 
15.01  Emergency or disaster. In accordance with and at the time required by the provisions of FCC regulations part 11, subpart D, section 11, and as such provisions may from time to time be amended, grantee shall install and maintain an emergency alert system (EAS) for use in transmitting pursuant to such regulations in the event of an emergency. Grantee shall provide the town with the ability to activate the EAS from multiple locations to override both audio and video of all programming services simultaneously during a period of emergency or disaster. Such emergency alert capability shall be operational throughout the term of this franchise. Grantee shall provide the appropriate training to town personnel as may be necessary to operate the equipment and facilities necessary to satisfy this provision of the franchise. 
15.02  Interconnection of EAS. In the event that the town enters into franchise agreements with other cable service providers, to the extent technically and legally feasible, grantee shall cooperate with the town to create a system and/or procedure to simultaneously activate the EAS over all cable systems operating in the town. The cost of such interconnection shall be borne by the other cable operators connecting to the grantee's facilities. 
SECTION 16  
16.0 - Employment requirements. 
16.01  Equal opportunity in employment. Grantee shall afford equal opportunity in employment to all qualified persons. No person shall be discriminated against in employment because of race, color, religion, sex, or national origin. 
SECTION 17  
17.0 - Other business activity. 
17.01  Limitations and restrictions. Subject to applicable state and federal law, this franchise only authorizes the grantee to provide those services or engage in business activities specifically identified herein. Such limitation is not a prohibition on grantee from providing services or engaging in business activities which the town cannot lawfully restrict or condition. 
SECTION 18  
18.0 - Payment to town. 
18.01  Amount and time. As compensation for the right, privilege, and franchise herein conferred, grantee shall pay to the town each year during the term of this franchise a sum equal to five percent of the grantee's gross revenue. Such payments shall be made quarterly within 45 days after the expiration of each calendar quarter. Accompanying the payment, grantee shall file a financial statement prepared according to generally accepted accounting practice showing in detail the gross revenues used in the computation of said payment. Such statement shall be signed by an officer or certified public accountant of the grantee. 
18.02  Right of inspection of records. The town shall have the right to inspect grantee's records showing the gross revenues from which payments to the town are computed and to audit and recompute any and all amounts paid under this franchise. The town's right to audit and the grantee's obligation to retain records related to a franchise fee audit shall expire three years after each franchise fee payment has been made to the town. Pursuant to subsection 2.01, paragraph Q, subparagraph (i), as part of any franchise fee audit, the town shall specifically have the right to review records related to the allocation of revenue to Cable services in the event grantee offers cable services bundled with non-cable services. 
18.03  Late payment charge. Grantee shall pay a late charge in an amount which is the greater of $100.00 or ten percent per annum, compounded daily, on franchise fee payments, or portions thereof, that are paid subsequent to the payment dates specified in subsection 18.01. The town shall provide written notice to the grantee that such payments have not been received in accordance with the dates specified in subsection 18.01, but such notice does not negate any late charge owed to the town beginning on the day following the required date of receipt under subsection 18.01. In the event the town identifies, as a result of an audit, amounts owed by the grantee from prior periods, the grantee shall pay a late charge of eight percent per annum, compounded quarterly, on the amounts identified, calculated from the date each portion of the underpayment was originally due until the date grantee remits the underpayment to the town. In the event that any audit or recomputation of fees results in an underpayment of greater than five percent (prior to the late charge) for the audit period, grantee shall reimburse the town for its costs to conduct the audit or recomputation. 
18.04  Acceptance. Payments received from the grantee under this section shall not in any way limit or impair any of the privileges or rights of the town, whether under this franchise or otherwise. No acceptance of any payment shall be construed as an accord that the amount paid is the correct amount, nor shall acceptance be construed as a release of any claim that the town may have for additional amounts payable under the provisions of this section, subject to the limitations in subsection 18.02. 
18.05  Evasion of franchise fees. Any transaction or arrangement made for the purpose of or knowingly results in the evasion of franchise fees payable under this franchise is prohibited. 
18.06  Additional commitments not franchise fees. The franchise fee payable hereunder shall be exclusive of and in addition to all ad valorem taxes, special assessments, fees for municipal improvements, the PEG capital fee, and other lawful obligations of grantee to town. Although the total sum of franchise fee payments and additional commitments set forth elsewhere in this franchise may total more than five percent of grantee's gross revenues in any annual period, grantee agrees that the additional commitments herein are neither franchise fees as defined under any federal law in effect as of the effective date of this franchise, nor are the additional payments to be offset or credited against any franchise fee payments due to the town, nor do they represent an increase in franchise fees to be passed through to subscribers. 
SECTION 19  
19.0 - Records and reports. 
19.01  Notice. Unless expressly otherwise agreed between the parties, every notice or response required by the franchise to be served upon the town or the grantee shall be in writing, and shall be deemed to have been duly given to the required party when hand delivered, or five business days after having been posted in a properly sealed and correctly addressed envelope sent by certified or registered mail, postage prepaid. 
The notices or responses to the town shall be addressed as follows: 
Town of Flower Mound 
Attention: Town Manager 
2121 Cross Timbers Road 
Flower Mound, Texas 75028 
The notices or responses to the grantee shall be addressed as follows: 
Advantex Communications/Grande Communications 
Attention: General Manager 
7701 South Stemmons 
Suite 210 
Corinth, Texas 76210 
With a copy to: 
Advantex Communications/Grande Communications 
Attention: Legal & Regulatory Division 
401 Carlson Circle 
San Marcos, Texas 78666 
The town and the grantee may designate such other address or addresses from time to time by giving notice to the other. 
19.02  Books of account. The town, through its duly designated officers, agents, or representatives shall have access to all books of accounts and records of grantee which are reasonably related to the enforcement of this franchise. Grantee shall keep complete and accurate books of accounts and records of its business and operations under and in connection with this franchise. All such books of accounts and records reasonably related to the enforcement of this franchise shall be made available for inspection by the town at an office of the grantee located within the Dallas metropolitan area during normal business hours upon reasonable advance notice. In the alternative, and at grantee's discretion, grantee may make books available in other locations, but must pay the travel costs for a town representative to visit this site if such review is requested by the town. Grantee shall maintain the books and records for franchise compliance purposes for a period of three years. 
19.03  Quarterly reports. A report shall be filed by grantee with the town within 30 days following the end of each calendar quarter, or portion thereof during which the franchise is in effect, beginning with the fourth quarter of calendar year 2004. The material substance of the report shall be in a form reasonably acceptable to the town. The information contained within the quarterly report shall include, but not be limited to the following: 
A.  A summary of the extent to which grantee has met the customer service standards included in exhibit A of this franchise. 
The quarterly reports may be submitted in conjunction with the payments to the town as required in subsection 18.01. 
19.04  Confidentiality. The town agrees to treat as confidential any books or records that constitute proprietary or confidential information under federal or state law, to the extent grantee makes the town aware of such confidentiality. Grantee shall be responsible for clearly and conspicuously stamping the word "Confidential" on each page that contains confidential or proprietary information, and shall provide a brief written explanation as to why such information is confidential under state or federal law. If the town believes it must release any such confidential books and records in the course of enforcing this franchise, or for any other reason, it shall advise grantee in advance so that grantee may take appropriate steps to protect its interests. If the town receives a demand from any person for disclosure of any information designated by grantee as confidential, the town shall, so far as consistent with applicable law, advise grantee and provide grantee with a copy of any written request by the party demanding access to such information within a reasonable time. Until otherwise ordered by a court or agency of competent jurisdiction, the town agrees that, to the extent permitted by state and federal law, it shall deny access to any of grantee's books and records marked confidential as set forth above to any person. 
SECTION 20  
20.0 - Regulation of rates. 
20.01  Town regulation of grantee's rates. The town council shall regulate, by ordinance, the rates for any and all of those cable services and related installations and equipment of grantee subject to regulation by the town, consistent with FCC rules governing rate regulation and the provisions of the Communications Act. In such event the town council shall first prescribe by ordinance the procedure and standards to be followed and the extent and scope of such rate regulations, all of which matters shall be consistent with due process and shall conform to any and all of those federal and state laws, rules, and regulations then applicable. Subject to its authority to regulate rates the town shall have access to all books and records related to grantee's rates including bulk contract rate information, subject to applicable law. 
20.02  Notice of rates. Grantee shall provide written notice of its then current rates and charges for any and all of its cable services in the town in compliance with any timing requirements prescribed in FCC regulations. 
SECTION 21  
21.0 - Free drops and service. 
21.01  Free drops and service. Grantee shall, at no cost, continue to provide one outlet of basic cable service and expanded basic cable service to all town-owned and occupied buildings, schools, and public libraries where such service is provided as of the effective date of this franchise. For purposes of this subsection, "school" means all state-accredited K-12 public and private schools. In addition, grantee shall provide, at no cost, one outlet of basic cable service and expanded basic cable service to new or relocated, owned, or leased and occupied town buildings, schools, and libraries where service is not being provided as of the effective date of this franchise upon request, and if the drop line from the feeder cable to such building does not exceed 150 feet, or if the town, school, or library agrees to pay the incremental cost of such drop line in excess of 150 feet, including the cost of such excess labor and materials. Such obligation to provide free cable service shall not extend to areas of town buildings where the grantee would normally enter into a commercial contract to provide such cable service (e.g., golf courses, airport restaurants and concourses, and recreation center work out facilities). Outlets of basic cable service and expanded basic cable service provided in accordance with this subsection may only be used to distribute cable services throughout such buildings upon the express agreement of the grantee. Any cable service provided under this subsection may only be used for lawful purposes. 
SECTION 22  
22.0 - Prohibition of discriminatory or preferential practices. 
22.01  Rates, charges, and services. In its rates or charges, or in making available cable, or in its rules or regulations, or in any other respect, grantee shall not make or grant preference or advantage to any subscriber or potential subscriber and shall not subject any such person to any prejudice or disadvantage. This provision shall not be deemed to prohibit promotional campaigns to stimulate subscriptions to the cable system or other legitimate uses thereof. 
SECTION 23  
23.0 - Non-exclusive franchise. 
23.01  Franchise non-exclusive. The rights, privileges, and franchise granted hereby are not exclusive and nothing herein contained shall be construed to prevent town from granting any like or similar rights, privileges, and franchise to any other person within all or any portion of town. The town shall make reasonable efforts to ensure that any person providing video programming services and/or cable services does not enter into the public rights-of-way in the franchise area on terms or conditions materially more favorable or less burdensome to such person than those applied to the grantee pursuant to this franchise. 
23.02  Disputes. In the event that the town grants a franchise to another person to provide video programming and/or cable services in the town, grantee shall have no longer than three months from the date grantee receives a copy of such franchise to notify the town, in writing, of any alleged discrimination between this franchise and the burdens and rights provided in such other franchise. Failure to notify the town shall estop grantee from any further action related to allegations of discrimination regarding the granting of such franchise. This subsection is not intended to prevent grantee from any action related to the town's actual administration of such franchise that the grantee believes is discriminatory. 
SECTION 24  
24.0 - Material breach of franchise, notice and liquidated damages. 
24.01  Notice of default; opportunity to cure; public hearing. 
A.  Notice of default. The town shall notify the grantee, in writing, of an alleged failure to comply with a provision of this franchise, which notice shall specify the alleged failure with reasonable particularity. The grantee shall have 30 days subsequent to receipt of the notice in which to: 
(i)  Correct the violation before the town may take further action or with respect to any such violation, if by reason of the nature thereof such violation cannot with due diligence be wholly cured within such period of 30 days, then the 30-day period shall be extended for such period of time as may be necessary to complete the correction of the same with all due diligence, but in no event longer than 90 days unless a further extension of time is approved by the town council; or 
(ii)  Provide a written response to the town, presenting facts and arguments in refutation or excuse of such alleged failure. 
B.  If the town is unsatisfied with the grantee's response under subsection 24.01, paragraph A, the town shall hold a public hearing on the matter. Grantee must be given at least ten days' notice of the hearing. At the hearing, the grantee shall be entitled to all the rights of due process consistent with the town procedures, including, but not limited to, the right to present evidence and the right to be represented by counsel. The grantee shall make available to the town, if requested, any records, documents or other information reasonably necessary to its consideration of the matter. Following the public hearing, the town may determine: 
(i)  Whether a failure to comply with a franchise provision has occurred; 
(ii)  Whether such failure is excusable; and 
(iii)  Whether such failure has been cured or will be cured by the grantee. After the hearing, grantee will be provided with a written copy of any action taken by the town council, along with supporting documents. 
C.  If the town determines that a failure to comply with a provision of the franchise has occurred and that such failure is not excusable and has not been or will not be cured by the grantee in a manner and in accordance with a schedule reasonably satisfactory to the town, then the town may take any actions provided in subsection 24.02. 
D.  In the event grantee fails to make a franchise fee payment as require by subsection 18.01, fails to make the PEG payments specified in subsection 14.10, paragraphs A through E, or fails to maintain insurance in accordance with section 9, the town is not required to conduct the public hearing identified in paragraph A above, but may proceed directly to subsection 24.02 for the procedures in paragraph A above. 
24.02  Town action in event of breach. In the event that grounds exist which give the town reason to believe that the grantee failed to comply with a material provision of this franchise, then the town may, at any time during the term of this franchise, to the extent lawful: 
A.  Seek specific performance of any provision, which reasonably lends itself to such remedy, as an alternative to damages; 
B.  Commence an action at law for monetary damages from the grantee as compensation for such material breach; 
C.  Seek liquidated damages pursuant to subsection 24.03; and/or 
D.  In the case of breach of a material provision of the franchise or other material violation as set forth in subsections 25.01 and 25.02, seek to revoke the franchise pursuant to subsection 25.03. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the town may not pursue monetary damages or liquidated damages for late payment of franchise fees in addition to the interest specified in subsection 18.03, or for late payment of the PEG capital fee in addition to the interest specified in subsection 14.10, paragraph F. 
24.03  Liquidated damages. In the event the town's selected course of action following the process set forth in subsections 24.01 and 24.02 is to impose liquidated damages, the town shall give grantee written notice of its intent, and a reasonable period of time following receipt of the notice, not less than 30 days and not more than 90 days unless a longer period is approved by the town council, to cure the alleged violation. If grantee remains in violation of the franchise following this cure period, the town may charge to and collect from the grantee the liquidated damages set forth below, with the liquidated damages beginning to accrue no earlier than the day following the end of the cure periods. The parties agree that actual damages that might be sustained by the town by reason of the breach by grantee of the provisions of this franchise set forth below are uncertain and difficult of ascertainment, and that the sums set forth below would be reasonable compensation for such breach, and grantee promises to pay, and the town agrees to accept, such sums as liquidated damages, and not as a penalty, in the event of such breach. Additionally such sums of money shall be considered liquidated damages due the town by grantee by reason of inconvenience to the public and because of public works supervision and maintenance and other town administrative time and involvement which resulted in the expenditure of public funds due to grantee's failure to comply with certain provisions in this franchise. Grantee covenants that any such sums paid to the town under this provision of the franchise shall not be included in the development of any rate, change, or price for services charged to subscribers. 
A.  For failure of grantee to provide any report, certificate or map to the town as required by this franchise, $50.00 per day. 
B.  For failure of grantee to respond, restore or repair the public rights-of-way within 48 hours of notice by town under subsection 7.03, $250.00 per day for every day following 48 hours after grantee's receipt of the notice. Should the town adopt any lawful and generally applicable ordinance governing the public rights-of-way which includes administrative fees for failure to restore the public rights-of-way, such fees in the ordinance shall apply to the grantee and supersede the ability of the town to collect liquidated damages under this provision of the franchise. 
C.  If town is required to relocate grantee's facilities under subsection 7.04, grantee shall pay $1,000.00 to the town in addition to reimbursement of the costs incurred by the town in relocating the facilities. Should the town adopt any lawful and generally applicable ordinance governing the public rights-of-way which includes administrative fees for town-performed relocation of grantee facilities, such fees in the ordinance shall apply to the grantee and supersede the ability of the town to collect liquidated damages under this provision of the franchise. 
D.  For failure of grantee to provide the PEG channels as required by subsections 14.01, 14.02, or 14.08, $100.00 per day. 
E.  For failure of grantee to provide the return lines required by subsection 14.06, $100.00 per day. 
F.  For failure of grantee to provide the town the ability to activate the EAS as required by subsection 15.01, $500.00 per day. 
G.  For failure of grantee to provide the notice of rates as required by subsection 20.02, $50.00 per day. 
H.  For failure to comply with the service extension requirements set forth in section 28, the greater of $250.00 per day or $1.00 per day per impacted subscriber. 
I.  Force majeure. Other than its failure, refusal, or inability to pay its debts and obligations, including, specifically, the payments to town required by this franchise, grantee shall not be declared in default or be subject to any sanction under any provision of this franchise in those cases in which performance of such provision is prevented by reasons beyond its control. 
24.04  Reservation of rights. The rights reserved to the town under this section are in addition to all other rights of the town whether reserved by this franchise or authorized by law, and no action, proceeding or exercise of a right shall affect any other right the town may have. 
SECTION 25  
25.0 - Revocation of franchise. 
25.01  General. In addition to all rights and powers of the town by virtue of this franchise or otherwise, the town reserves, as an additional and as a separate and distinct power, the right to revoke the franchise in accordance with the procedures specified herein if any of the following events occur or for any of the following reasons: 
A.  Grantee by act or omission substantially violates any material term, condition, or provision of this franchise and shall fail or refuse to effect material compliance following the notice and opportunity to cure specified under subsection 24.01; or 
B.  Grantee knowingly or willingly attempts to evade any material provision of this franchise; or 
C.  Repeated and substantial violation or willful disregard of: 
(i)  Town's lawful ordinances and regulations related to the public rights-of-way; or 
(ii)  The customer service standards in exhibit A; or 
(iii)  The cable system technical performance requirements in subsections 12.01 and 12.02. 
D.  The occurrence of any event which may reasonably lead to the foreclosure or other similar judicial or non-judicial sale of all or any material part of the cable system; or 
E.  Grantee becomes insolvent or is adjudged bankrupt or all or any part of grantee's facilities are sold under an instrument to secure a debt and are not redeemed by grantee within 30 days from the date of such sale; provided, however, this shall not be an event of termination or cancellation in the event of bankruptcy proceeding and the trustee, receiver, or debtor in possession agrees in writing to be bound by the terms of this franchise; or 
F.  Grantee has been found by a court of law to have practiced any fraud or deceit in its conduct or relations under this franchise with the town, subscribers or potential subscribers. 
25.02  Material provisions. Material terms of this franchise include, but are not limited to: 
A.  The indemnification required by section 8. 
B.  The insurance required by subsection 9.01. 
C.  The channel capacity required by subsection 10.01. 
D.  The emergency standby power required by subsection 10.03, paragraph B. 
E.  The PEG channels as required by subsections 14.01 and 14.02. 
F.  The PEG capital fee required by subsection 14.10, paragraph B. 
G.  The EAS required by subsection 15.01. 
H.  Payment of franchise fees as required by subsection 18.01. 
I.  Non-discrimination in rates and services as required by section 22. 
J.  Town approval of transfers and changes of control as required by subsections 26.01 and 26.02. 
25.03  Method of revocation. Should the town council determine, following the process set forth in subsections 24.01 and 24.02, that its selected course of action shall be to seek revocation of the franchise, the town shall give grantee written notice of such intent. The notice shall set forth the causes and reasons for the proposed revocation, shall advise grantee that it will be provided an opportunity to be heard by town regarding such proposed action before any such action is taken, and shall set forth the time, date, and place of the hearing. In no event shall such hearing be held less than 30 days following delivery of such notice to grantee. At the hearing, the grantee shall be entitled to all rights of due process consistent with the town procedures, including but not limited to the right to present evidence and the right to be represented by counsel. Any such revocation of this franchise shall be by ordinance. 
25.04  Grantee may appeal town's decision. The grantee may appeal the town's decision to revoke the franchise to an appropriate court, which shall have the power to review the town's decision de novo and to modify or reverse such decision as justice may require. Such appeal to the appropriate court must be taken within 60 days of the issuance of the determination of the town. 
SECTION 26  
26.0 - Assignment of franchise. 
26.01  Town approval of assignment required. This franchise shall be a privilege personal to the grantee and shall not be assigned or transferred, or otherwise encumbered, without the prior consent of the town. Two exceptions to the requirement of town consent are: 
A.  If such assignment or transfer is to an affiliate of comparable technical and financial capability as well as proven experience in managing and operating cable systems; or 
B.  For a transfer in trust, by mortgage, by other hypothecation, or by assignment of any rights, title, or interest of the grantee in the franchise or cable system in order to secure indebtedness. Transfer to an affiliate shall mandate notification from grantee concerning the transfer or assignment. 
C.  For all other requests by grantee to assign or transfer this franchise, grantee shall provide appropriate written notification pursuant to FCC regulations. Within 30 days of receiving the request for transfer, the town shall notify the grantee in writing of the information it requires to determine the legal, financial, and technical qualifications of the transferee. If the town has not taken action on the grantee's request for transfer within 120 days after receiving such request, and provided the town has promptly received from grantee the information it requested in connection with the request, consent by the town shall be deemed given. The town may condition its consent to the transfer upon such terms and conditions reasonably related to the legal, technical and financial qualifications of the transferee. No assignment to any person shall be effective until the transferee has filed with the town an instrument in writing, duly executed, reciting the fact of such assignment, accepting the terms of this franchise, and agreeing to comply with all of the provisions hereof, subject to applicable law. 
26.02  Town approval of transfer of control required. The grantee shall promptly notify the town of any actual or proposed change in, or transfer of, or disposition or acquisition by any other person in control of the grantee. Every change, transfer, or acquisition of control of the grantee shall make the franchise subject to cancellation unless and until the town shall have consented thereto provided that the town has acted within the time constraints required by law. For the purpose of determining whether it shall consent to such change, transfer, disposition, or acquisition of control, the town may inquire into the legal, financial, and technical qualifications of the prospective controlling party, but shall do so within 30 days of receipt of the requested transfer from the grantee. Grantee shall assist the town in such inquiry and will respond within ten days unless a longer time is reasonably necessary or allowed by law. 
SECTION 27  
27.0 - Failure of town to enforce franchise. 
27.01  No waiver of terms. The grantee shall not be excused from complying with each and all of the terms, conditions, and provisions of this franchise even though the town should upon one or more occasions fail to insist upon, require, or seek compliance with any such term, condition, or provision. 
SECTION 28  
28.0 - Service availability. 
28.01  Service availability. The grantee shall provide cable service throughout the entire franchise area, subject to the provisions below. 
28.02  Annexations. If the town annexes any contiguous territory which is being provided cable service by the grantee or its affiliates, the annexed area will be subject to the provisions of this franchise upon the effective date of the annexation; provided, however, that grantee shall be allowed a reasonable time under the circumstances to make any required modifications to the cable system, cable services, billing system, etc., as may be required to accommodate such change, and provided that if the area is serviced by an affiliate, a transfer of ownership of the cable system in that area to the grantee shall not be required by the town. If the annexed area is being provided comparable cable service by another provider, grantee shall have the right, but not the requirement, to extend its cable system to the annexed area. In the event that the annexed territory is contiguous and not being provided cable service by any provider, grantee agrees that it shall within 12 months extend its cable system into the newly annexed territory under the terms of subsection 28.03. In the event that the annexed area is not contiguous to the franchise area existing as of the effective date of this franchise, grantee shall not have the obligation to extend to such area. 
28.03  Extension policy. Within six months of a qualified request as described herein, grantee must extend and make cable service available to every lot or tract of land for which the owner or occupant thereof has requested cable service in all unserved areas having at least ten dwelling units constructed or planned for construction per 1,320 cable bearing strand feet or 25 dwelling units per cable bearing strand mile, as measured from the portion of the existing cable system which is to be extended. Extensions shall be at grantee's cost. For purposes of this section, "planned for construction" shall have the meaning of fully prepared lots.
