      Town Secretary 	
 	 
ORDINANCE NO. 47-96 
An ordinance amending the existing franchise between the Town of Flower Mound and Texas Utilities Electric Company to provide for a different consideration; providing an effective date; providing for acceptance by Texas Utilities Electric Company; and finding and determining that the meeting at which this ordinance is passed is open to the public as required by law. 
Whereas, Texas Utilities Electric Company (hereinafter called "TU Electric") is engaged in the business of providing electric utility service within the Town of Flower Mound (hereinafter called "town") and is using the public streets, alleys, grounds, and rights-of-way within the town for that purpose under the terms of a franchise ordinance heretofore duly passed by the governing body of the town and duly accepted by TU Electric; and 
Whereas, TU Electric has, pursuant to said franchise ordinance, been paying to the town a sum equal to three percent of its gross receipts from the retail sale of electric power and energy within the town for the rights and privileges set forth in said franchise ordinance and, in addition thereto, has reimbursed the town for its ratemaking expenses pursuant to Section 2.106 of the Public Utility Regulatory Act of 1995; and 
Whereas, the town and TU Electric desire to amend said franchise ordinance to provide for a different consideration to consist of a sum equal to four percent of its gross receipts from the retail sale of electric power and energy within the town; which different consideration includes, among other things, TU Electric's obligation to reimburse the town for its ratemaking and other regulatory expenses to be incurred by the town involving the regulation of TU Electric; 
Now, therefore, be it ordained by the Town Council of the Town of Flower Mound, Texas:  
Section 1. - Rates change. 
The consideration payable by TU Electric for the rights and privileges granted to TU Electric by the franchise ordinance heretofore duly passed by the governing body of this town and duly accepted by TU Electric is hereby changed to be four percent of its gross receipts from the retail sale of electric power and energy within the corporate limits of the town, said changed percentage to be applied to said gross receipts beginning on the first day of the month immediately following the date on which TU Electric accepts this ordinance, and being payable as specified in said franchise ordinance and based upon the same time periods as specified in said franchise ordinance and being payment for the said rights and privileges during the period specified in said franchise ordinance, said payment being in lieu of and shall be accepted as payment for all of TU Electric's obligations to pay municipal charges, fees, rentals, pole rentals, wire taxes, inspection fees, easement taxes, franchise taxes, certain regulatory expenses under Section 2.106 of the Public Utility Regulatory Act of 1995 or any similar or successor law, or other charges and taxes of every kind, except ad valorem taxes, sales and use taxes, and special taxes and assessments for public improvements.  
Section 2. - One-time payment; calculation. 
TU Electric shall make a one-time payment hereunder for the purpose of making the changed consideration as specified in section 1 hereof effective as specified in said section 1 without altering the payment dates specified in said franchise ordinance heretofore duly passed by the governing body of this town and duly accepted by TU Electric, said one-time payment being due and payable 30 days after TU Electric's acceptance of this ordinance as provided in section 7 hereof, and being a sum calculated as follows: (a) TU Electric shall determine the monthly average of its gross receipts from the retail sale of electric power and energy within the town during the period upon which the most recent franchise payment made to the town prior to the date determined in accordance with section 1 hereof was based; (b) the said monthly average of its said gross receipts shall be multiplied by one percent; and (c) the product so calculated shall be multiplied by the number of whole months from the date determined in accordance with section 1 hereof through the last day of the last month of the period for which the most recent franchise payment made to the town prior to said date determined in accordance with section 1 hereof was made.  
Section 3. - Reimbursement of expenses. 
Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in section 1 hereof, if TU Electric files general rate cases and the town incurs cumulative expenses, otherwise reimbursable by TU Electric under Section 2.106 of the Public Utility Regulatory Act of 1995 or similar or successor law in excess of $4 million, then in such event, TU Electric shall reimburse all of the expenses incurred by the town in connection with all general rate cases filed during the period beginning with the effective date hereof and ending on September 30, 2008, in excess of said $4 million. The term "general rate case" as used in this ordinance means a rate case initiated by TU Electric in which it seeks to increase its rates charged to a substantial number of its customer classes in the town and elsewhere in its system and in which TU Electric's overall revenues are in setting such rates. The town agrees to exercise reasonable best efforts, considering the facts and circumstances, to keep its expenses on average to under $1,000,000.00 per general rate case.  
Section 4. - Ratemaking expenses; reimbursement. 
Notwithstanding the provisions of section 1 hereof, TU Electric will continue to reimburse the town's ratemaking expenses, if any, in connection with the appeal and any remand of Public Utility Commission of Texas Docket No. 9300 that are otherwise reimbursable under Section 2.106 of the Public Utility Regulatory Act of 1995, but will not continue to reimburse the town's ratemaking expenses, if any, in connection with Public Utility Commission of Texas Docket No. 11735; the town hereby agrees that any ratemaking expenses incurred in connection with said Docket No. 11735 that the town incurs on appeal or on remand of said Docket No. 11735 will be the Town's sole responsibility and further agrees in the events that the town is a participant in the join intervention of cities managed by the steering committee of TU Electric Service Area Cities intervening in Docket No. 11735, that the town decides to continue to participate with the steering committee in such appeal of said order, and TU Electric is required to reimburse said steering committee for ratemaking expenses under Section 2.106 of the Public Utility Regulatory Act of 1995 that are incurred on appeal or remand of said Docket No. 11735—to reimburse TU Electric the town's share of reimbursable expenses related to said appeal and remand and owed by TU Electric to said steering committee determined by the methodology chosen by the said steering committee (the town to notify TU Electric of the method so chosen by the steering committee prior to the submission of an invoice by the steering committee for the payment by TU Electric of said reimbursable expenses related to said appeal or remand)  
Section 5. - Formula for amount calculated. 
Notwithstanding the provisions of section 3 hereof, in the event that the City of Dallas incurs cumulative expenses in connection with general rate cases filed by TU Electric during the period beginning with the effective date hereof and ending September 30, 2008, in excess of $4 million and TU Electric reimburses the City of Dallas such excess, then, in that event, TU Electric will reimburse the town's reasonable expenses actually incurred that are otherwise reimbursable under Section 2.106 of the Public Utility Regulatory Act of 1995, Article 1446c-0, V.A.T.S. (The "PURA"), limited, however to an amount calculated in accordance with the following formula: 
A = [(B - $4,000,000.00) - B] × C, 
where: 
A = The amount reimbursable to the town; 
B = The total amount of expenses incurred by the City of Dallas prior to September 30, 2008, in connection with general rate cases filed by TU Electric, which expenses would be reimbursable under Section 2.106 of the PURA to the City of Dallas except for the terms of TU Electric's current franchise with the City of Dallas, but excluding all such expenses incurred in connection with Public Utility Commission of Texas Dockets Nos. 9300 and 11735; and 
C = The total amount of expenses incurred by the town prior to September 30, 2008, in connection with general rate cases filed by TU Electric, which expenses would be reimbursable under Section 2.106 of the PURA except for the terms of this franchise amendment but excluding all such expenses incurred in connection with Public Utility Commission of Texas Dockets Nos. 9300 and 11735; and  
Section 6. - Ordinance to remain in full force and effect. 
In all respects, except as specifically and amended by this ordinance, the said franchise ordinance heretofore duly passed by the governing body of this town and duly accepted by TU Electric shall remain in full force and effect according to its terms until said franchise ordinance terminates as provided therein.  
Section 7. - Effective date; acceptance. 
This ordinance shall take effect from and after its final passage and TU Electric's acceptance. TU Electric shall, within 15 days from the passage of this ordinance, file its written acceptance of this ordinance with the office of the town secretary in substantially the following form: 
To the Honorable Mayor and Town Council: 
Texas Utilities Electric Company (TU Electric, acting by and through the undersigned authorized officer, hereby accepts, on this the 25th day of October 1996, Ordinance No. 47-96 amending the current franchise between the town and TU Electric. 
	TEXAS UTILITIES ELECTRIC COMPANY 
	By: /s/ _____
Senior Vice President 
  
Section 8. - Passed and approved. 
It is hereby officially found and determined that the meeting at which this ordinance is passed is open to the public as required by law and that public notice of the time, place and purpose of said meeting was given as required. 
Passed and approved by the Town Council of the Town of Flower Mound, Texas, on first reading on this the 19th day of August, 1996. 
Passed and approved by the Town Council of the Town of Flower Mound, Texas, on second and final reading on this the 21st day of October, 1996.

ORDINANCE NO. 18-99 
An ordinance of the Town Council of the Town of Flower Mound, Texas, approving rate schedules for Texas Utilities Electric Company, providing an effective date therefor, providing conditions under which such rate schedules may be changed, modified, amended or withdrawn, finding and determining that the meeting at which this ordinance is passed is open to the public as required by law. 
Now therefore, be it ordained by the Town Council of the Town of Flower Mound, Texas, that:  
Section 1. - Time-of-use rate schedules. 
On January 15, 1999, Texas Utilities Electric Company (hereinafter referred to as "TU Electric") filed with the governing body of this municipality a statement of intent and application to implement within the corporate limits of this municipality proposed new rate schedules that provide additional rate options for its customers, which options are entirely voluntary on the part of the customer, namely its proposed rate GTU-M-general service time-of-use-municipality, proposed rate RTU 1-M-residential time-of-use service-municipality, and proposed rate GTUC-M-general service time-of-use voluntary curtailable-municipality (said three proposed new rate schedules hereinafter collectively referred to as the "time-of-use rate schedules").  
Section 2. - Approval. 
The time-of-use rate schedules are hereby approved, and TU Electric is authorized to render service and to collect charges as specified in the time-of-use rate schedules from its customers electing to receive electric service under said time-of-use rate schedules within the corporate limits of this municipality until such time as said rate schedules may be changed, modified, amended or withdrawn with the approval of the governing body of this municipality.  
Section 3. - Effective time period. 
The time-of-use rate schedules herein approved shall be effective from and after the final passage and approval of this ordinance.  
Section 4. - Notice. 
The filing of said time-of-use rate schedules shall constitute notice to the consumers of electricity within its municipality of the availability and application of such time-of-use rate schedules.  
Section 5. - Recovery of revenue prohibited. 
TU Electric shall not seek any additional rate or surcharge mechanism to recover any revenues lost on account of the application of these time-of-use rates, and there shall be no imputed revenues on account of any reduction in TU Electric's revenues that may result from the application of these time-of-use rates.  
Section 6. - Riders. 
The rate reductions approved by the Public Utility Commission of Texas in Docket No. 18490 shall be applied to the time-of-use rates approved herein, such that rider RRD shall be applicable to rate RTU 1-M, rider GSRD shall be applied to all customers taking secondary service under either rate GTU-M designated as GTU-M-SEC or under rate GTUC-M designated as GTUC-M-SEC, and rider RD shall be applied to all other customers on rate GTU-M or rate GTUC-M.  
Section 7. - Base rate case; rate classes. 
In its next general base rate case in which the time-of-use rates herein approved are at issue, TU Electric will either (a) include all customers taking service under rate GTUC or GTUC-M during the test year involved in such base rate case as a separate rate class in its cost allocation study, or (b) include in its cost allocation study the load and revenue data applicable to each GTUC or GTUC-M customer taking service under rate GTUC or GTU-CM during the test year involved in such base rate case with the load and revenue data of the rate class applicable to such GTUC or GTUC-M customer immediately prior to such customer's taking service under rate GTUC or GTUC-M. In the event, however, that industry restructuring is mandated by legislative changes prior to the time that TU Electric has another general base rate case and such legislation authorizes the recovery by TU Electric of any stranded costs from its various customer classes in accordance with its last approved cost of service study, the customers then receiving service under the time-of-use rates will be included in the customer classes reflected in TU Electric's most recent cost of service study as follows: 
(a)  Customers on rate RTU1-M shall be included in rate class RTU; 
(b)  Customers on rate GTU-M shall be included in rate class HV, GP, or GS, depending upon the voltage level of the service, such that customers on rate GTU-M receiving service at high voltages shall be included in rate class HV, customers receiving service at primary distribution voltages shall be included in rate class GP, and customers receiving service at secondary distribution voltages shall be included in rate class GS; and 
(c)  Customers on rate GTUC-M shall be included in rate class NI (noticed interruptible) depending upon the voltage level of the service, such that customers on rate GTUC-M receiving service at high voltages shall be included in rate class NI (High Voltage), customers on rate GTUC-M receiving service at primary distribution voltages shall be included in rate NI (primary), and customers on rate GTUC-M receiving service at secondary distribution voltages shall be included in rate NI (secondary).  
Section 8. - Rates, operations and services. 
Nothing contained in this ordinance shall be construed now or hereafter as limiting or modifying in any manner the right and power of the governing body of this municipality under the law to regulate the rates, operations, and services of TU Electric.  
Section 9. - Public notice. 
It is hereby officially found and determined that the meeting at which this ordinance is passed is open to the public as required by law and that public notice of the time, place, and purpose of said meeting was given as required. 
Duly passed and approved by the Town Council of the Town of Flower Mound, Texas, by a vote of 4 to 0 on this the 15th day of February, 1999. 
	APPROVED: 
	/s/  _____
Lori L. DeLuca 
Mayor

/s/  _____
Paula Lawrence, CMC 
Town Secretary

/s/  _____

DIVISION 2 - COSERV ELECTRIC[13] 
An ordinance granting to Denton County Electric Cooperative, Inc., its successors and assigns, an electric light, heat and power franchise, and declaring an emergency. 
Be it ordained by the Town Commission of the Town of Flower Mound, Texas: 

Footnotes: 
--- (13) --- 
Editor's note— Printed herein is the electric franchise with CoServ Electric as the successor to Denton County Electric Company, Inc., as adopted on December 2, 1965. Amendments to the franchise, are indicated by parenthetical history notes following amended provisions. The absence of a history note indicates that the provision remains unchanged from the original franchise. Obvious misspellings and punctuation errors have been corrected without notation. For stylistic purposes, headings and catchlines have been made uniform and the same system of capitalization, citation to state statutes, and expression of numbers in text as appears in the Code of Ordinances has been used. Additions made for clarity are indicated by brackets. 
 
Section 1. - Grant of franchise. 
Subject to the terms and conditions mentioned in this ordinance, and until January 1, 2015, the right, privilege and franchise is hereby granted to Denton County Electric Cooperative, Inc., a corporation organized under the laws of the State of Texas, and its successors, lessees and assigns (herein called "grantee"), to erect, establish, construct, maintain and operate an electric power and transmission system in the Town of Flower Mound, Texas, (herein called the "town"), and to use the streets, highways, easements, parks, alleys, public squares and all other public lands and places of the town within the corporate limits as the same may from time to time exist, for the purpose of erecting, maintaining and operating its electric light and power lines, with all necessary or desirable appurtenances, including underground conduits, poles, wires, transmission lines and other structures and telephone lines for its own use, for the purpose of supplying electricity to said town and its inhabitants and to persons, firms, corporations and institutions beyond the corporate limits thereof for light, heat, power and other purposes.  
Section 2. - Conditions of street occupancy. 
The grantee shall erect, maintain, construct, operate and replace their electric light and power lines, and appurtenances, so as to interfere as little as feasible with traffic.  
Section 3. - Rules and regulation of service. 
The grantee herein, its successors, lessees and assigns, shall construct its electric power and transmission facilities in a good and workmanlike manner and shall furnish its customers in the town of Flower Mound, Texas, good, sufficient, and prompt service in all respects considering all circumstances. 
Such service, however, shall be subject to such reasonable rules and regulations as the grantee may promulgate.  
Section 4. - Rates and regulations. 
The grantor has determined and hereby finds that the rates and regulations now in force and effect in the area are fair and reasonable under existing circumstances.  
Section 5. - Modifying rate schedule and service regulation 
Should grantee, its successors, lessees and assigns, desire to put into effect within the Town of Flower Mound, Texas, a new rate schedule or a new service regulation or to change any existing rate schedule or service regulation or to withdraw the same, it shall file with the town secretary such new or changed rate schedule or service regulations or notice of withdrawal of any existing rate schedule or service regulation, and unless the town suspends or disapproves the same within 30 days from the time of such filing or notice of withdrawal, the new or changed rate schedule or service regulation or withdrawal of existing rate schedule or service regulation shall be in effect from date of filing and thereafter.  
Section 6. - Liability. 
The grantee agrees to hold and save the town harmless from any and all damages, claims, suits and liabilities arising out of the installation, operation and maintenance of its electric power and transmission system.  
Section 7. - Cumulative franchise. 
The franchise hereby granted is cumulative of and shall not repeal the provisions of that certain franchise granted by the Commissioners' Court of Denton County, Texas, by order entered on the 13th day of July, 1938, of record in Volume Q, Page 313, Minutes of the Commissioners' Court of Denton County, Texas.  
Section 8. - Franchise fee. 
A.  The Grantee agrees to pay to the Town of Flower Mound, Texas, on or before April 1, 2006, a sum of money equal to the sum of (i) three percent (3%) of the Gross Revenues (as defined below) for the period of January 1, 2005, through August 31, 2005, plus (ii) four percent (4%) of the Gross Revenues for the period of September 1, 2005, through December 31, 2005, for the use of the streets, highways, easements, alleys, parks, and all other public lands and places within the Town of Flower Mound, Texas, for the Grantee's poles, wires, conduits, pipes, fixtures and all other equipment and appurtenances related to its electric system in the Town. Further, the Grantee agrees to pay to the Town of Flower Mound, Texas, on or before April 1, 2007, and on or before the same day of each succeeding year during the life of this franchise, a sum of money equal to four percent (4%) of the Gross Revenues for the previous calendar year, for the use of the streets, highways, easements, alleys, parks, and all other public lands and places within the Town of Flower Mound, Texas, for the Grantee's poles, wires, conduits, pipes, fixtures and all other equipment and appurtenances related to its electric system in the Town. Such payment shall be in lieu of any other tax or increased rate of tax, or other imposition, assessment or charges, except ad valorem taxes. The Grantee shall, on the same date that payment is made, as provided for herein, file a report with the Town Secretary showing the Gross Revenues in the calendar year preceding the date of payment. The Town may have the books and records of the Grantee examined by a representative of the Town to verify the correctness of the report filed. 
B.  Gross Revenues 
As used herein, the term "Gross Revenues" means the annual revenues collected by the Grantee from its customers for the sale of electric energy to business and residential customers within the corporate limits of the Town, including miscellaneous fees such as connect or disconnect fees, deposits, returned check fees, new account fees, and delinquent charges. The term "Gross Revenues" shall not include revenue billed but not received; line extension charges or contributions in aid of construction in the form of one-time or periodic payments or monthly facilities charges; pole rental; taxes; revenue from materials or equipment sales; principal and/or interest payments on amounts loaned by the Grantee; or any fees required to be remitted by the Grantee to third parties. The Grantee is hereby authorized to surcharge to customers within the Town all or any portion of the Gross Revenues assessment. All bills for services rendered within the Town may be adjusted by the same percentage as the Gross Revenues assessment specified herein, less any percentage that is recovered by the Grantee through base rates or other charges. 
C.  Grantee Franchise Fee Recovery Tariff 
1.  To the extent required by applicable law, Grantee may file a tariff amendment(s) to provide for the recovery of the franchise fee payable hereunder. 
2.  The Town agrees: 
a.  to the extent the Town acts as regulatory authority, to adopt and approve that portion of any tariff which provides for 100 percent (100%) recovery (or such lesser amount requested by the Grantee) of the franchise fee payable hereunder as part of the Grantee's rates; 
b.  in the event the Town intervenes in any regulatory proceeding before a federal or state agency in which the recovery of such franchise fees is an issue, the Town will take an affirmative position supporting the 100 percent (100%) recovery of such franchise fees by the Grantee; and 
c.  in the event of an appeal of any such regulatory proceeding in which the Town has intervened, the Town will take an affirmative position in any such appeals in support of the 100 percent (100%) recovery of such franchise fees by the Grantee. 
3.  The Town agrees that it will take no action, nor cause any other person or entity to take any action, to prohibit the recovery of such franchise fees by the Grantee. 
(Ord. No. 59-05 § 8, 8-1-2005)  
Section 9. - Rights nonexclusive. 
This franchise is not exclusive, and nothing herein contained shall be construed so as to prevent the town from granting other, like and similar rights and privileges to any other person, firm or corporation.  
Section 10. - Permission to transfer franchise. 
This franchise is personal to the grantee herein and shall not be transferred or assigned to any other person, firm, or corporation without the written consent and approval of the Town of Flower Mound, Texas.  
Section 11. - Acceptance. 
The grantee shall, within 30 days from the approval of this ordinance, notify the mayor of the town of its consent and acceptance of the provisions and conditions of this ordinance, said notice to be by registered mail.  
Section 12. - Validity. 
If any section, sentence, clause or phase of this ordinance is for any reason held to be illegal, ultra vires or unconstitutional, such invalidity shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions of this ordinance.  
Section 13. - Effective date. 
The fact that the Town of Flower Mound, Texas, is in immediate need of the relief afforded by the provisions of this ordinance creates an emergency and an imperative public necessity requiring and demanding that any and all rules requiring ordinances to be read and repassed at more than one meeting be suspended, and that this ordinance take effect immediately upon its passage, and it is so ordained. 
Passed and approved on December 2, 1965.
